page.title: 03ATTITUDES -FEELINGS
page.content: What are the thoughts of a young girl after visiting Chatham cemetery? It is lonely and peaceful. Most of the tombstones are overgrown and crumbling. Some are as old as 1824. It is sad to see children who died as young as two days old. Many headstones have writing with "Loving Memory" or "Gone,but not forgotten". Lots of graves have green granite stone.Some are made of marble. More than one person may be buried together. A change of mood. On the Delce estate fear of unemployment and the gaining of material possessions are important issues.In Borstal many are keen to maintain a village feeling.
